item.title: DMart Shares Tank 6% As Q3 Earnings Fail To Impress D-Street; Should You Invest? - News18
item.description:
DMart Shares Tank 6% As Q3 Earnings Fail To Impress D-Street; Should You Invest?

Date: January 13, 2025 | Source: News18

Avenue Supermarts, the operator of the DMart retail chain, reported disappointing Q3 results leading to a significant drop in share prices. Investors are left questioning whether to buy, sell, or hold.

  • Avenue Supermarts shares fell by 5.7%, reaching Rs 3,474.
  • Q3FY25 revenue increased by 17.5% YoY, totaling Rs 15,565 crore.
  • Net profit rose 6.5% YoY to Rs 785 crore, but margins are under pressure.
  • EBITDA margin dropped to 7.9% from 8.5% YoY.
  • Same-store sales growth was reported at 8.3%.
  • The company will focus on both home delivery and pick-up services.
  • Analysts have adjusted their earnings projections downwards and have mixed ratings on DMart’s stock.
  • Management changes announced with a new CEO effective March 15, 2025.
“While discounting in the FMCG category remained intense, the impact on high-turnover stores in metro towns was lower than in the previous quarter.” - Neville Noronha, CEO

Investors are advised to closely monitor the company’s strategic changes and market performance amidst competitive pressures.

item.title: Stock market crash: Investors lose ₹25 lakh crore in four days of slump - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Stock market crash: Investors lose ₹25 lakh crore in four days of slump

Date: Jan 13, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Investments worth nearly ₹25 lakh crore in market valuation have been lost in the past four days of a severe drubbing in the equity market.

  • The market capitalisation of BSE-listed firms dropped to ₹4,17,05,906.74 crore ($4.82 trillion), a fall of ₹24,69,243.3 crore.
  • On Monday alone, investors' wealth dropped ₹12.61 lakh crore.
  • Continued foreign institutional investor selling crossed ₹20,000 crore this month, contributing to negative sentiments.
  • The Indian rupee touched a fresh low against the dollar during the session.
  • Oil prices reached their highest level in over three months due to expanded US sanctions disrupting Russian crude supplies.
  • Over the previous four sessions, BSE Sensex has tanked 1,869.1 points (2.39%).
  • 3,562 stocks declined, while 555 advanced and 131 remained unchanged on the BSE.
  • 508 stocks registered their 52-week lows.
“Continued foreign institutional investor selling crossed ₹20,000 crore this month, contributing to the negative sentiments.” - Siddhartha Khemka, Head - Research, Wealth Management, Motilal Oswal Financial Services Ltd.

This stock market slump highlights the growing concerns among investors and the impact of global economic factors on local markets.

item.title: Tether Announces it Will Relocate to El Salvador - Watcher Guru
item.description:
Tether Announces it Will Relocate to El Salvador

Date: January 13, 2025

Source: Watcher.Guru

Tether has announced its official relocation to El Salvador, highlighting the country as a “beacon of freedom.” This move follows the company obtaining a Digital Asset Service Provider license.

  • Tether's CEO, Paulo Ardoino, confirmed the relocation via social media.
  • The company is set to foster global Bitcoin adoption through this move.
  • El Salvador has been recognized for its forward-thinking market in the crypto landscape.
“This strategic positioning is helping to shape the future of financial systems, making the country a key player in the global fintech landscape.”

This relocation marks a significant step for Tether and could signal a trend for further crypto industry migration to pro-crypto nations.

item.title: Stocks to Watch on January 14: HCLTech, JSW Energy, Adani Energy Solutions, Quess Corp and more - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Stocks to Watch on January 14: HCLTech, JSW Energy, Adani Energy Solutions, Quess Corp and more

Date: January 14, 2025 Source: CNBC TV18

This article discusses the key stocks to monitor on January 14, highlighting recent performance updates from companies like HCLTech and JSW Energy.

  • HCLTech: Reported a 5.54% growth in net profit to ₹4,591 crore for the December quarter.
  • JSW Energy: Declared the successful applicant for the resolution plan for KSK Mahanadi Power Company Ltd.
  • Adani Energy Solutions: Transmission network expanded to 26,485 circuit kilometres, up 29.7% YoY.
  • Quess Corp: Received an income tax refund order for ₹20.74 crore.
  • Angel One: Reported an 8.1% YoY increase in net profit at ₹281.4 crore for the December quarter.
  • Delta Corp: Net profit rose 3.5% YoY to ₹35.7 crore.
  • Anand Rathi Wealth: Net profit increased by 33.3% YoY to ₹77.3 crore.
  • DEN Networks: Reported a 14.6% decline in net profit at ₹40.3 crore.
“The company’s transmission network expanded to 26,485 circuit kilometres (ckm), a 29.7% increase from the previous year’s 20,422 ckm.”

This summary outlines important updates from various stocks that investors should keep an eye on as trading continues to unfold on January 14.

item.title: Sensex Crashes 1,100 Points, Investors Lose Over Rs 14 Lakh Crore; Why Is Market Falling? - News18
item.description:
Sensex Crashes 1,100 Points, Investors Lose Over Rs 14 Lakh Crore; Why Is Market Falling?

Date: January 14, 2025 | Source: News18

Indian equity indices, BSE Sensex and Nifty50, experienced a severe drop in the market, affecting investor sentiment due to several underlying economic factors.

  • BSE Sensex fell by more than 1,100 points, reaching a low of 76,250.
  • Nifty50 lost 350 points, sliding to 23,047.
  • Market capitalization of BSE-listed companies declined by Rs 14.54 lakh crore.
  • The US jobs report indicated strong employment growth, impacting expectations for Federal Reserve rate cuts.
  • Persistent foreign selling was noted, with FPIs offloading equities worth over Rs 21,350 crore in January.
  • Global crude oil prices surged due to geopolitical tensions, straining India's fiscal health.
  • The Indian rupee hit an all-time low of Rs 86.27 against the US dollar.
  • Analysts project downgrades in corporate earnings growth.
“Markets are under pressure due to multiple headwinds. The strong US jobs data has reduced expectations of rate cuts by the Fed in 2025,” said VK Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist at Geojit Financial Services.

In conclusion, the market's significant fall illustrates the interconnected nature of global economic data and the impacts on local markets. Investors are advised to stay informed about these dynamics.

item.title: 'Words of our Chairman have been taken out of context,' says L&T HR head - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Words of our Chairman have been taken out of context,' says L&T HR head

Publication Date: Jan 13, 2025 Source: CNBC TV18

In response to the misunderstandings regarding comments made by L&T's MD & Chairman, SN Subrahmanyan, HR Head Sonica Muraleedharan defended his remarks, stating they were misinterpreted and emphasized the supportive corporate culture he fosters.

  • Sonica Muraleedharan highlighted that SNS did not mandate a 90-hour work week.
  • She expressed disappointment over the backlash and stressed the importance of understanding intentions.
  • Muraleedharan praised Subrahmanyan's leadership and commitment to employee welfare.
  • The controversy has drawn criticism from industry leaders, questioning the practicality of such work hours.
  • L&T reiterated its commitment to nation-building amidst the backlash.
"Leaders like SNS inspire positive change and growth, and it’s vital to recognise their efforts rather than misinterpret them." - Sonica Muraleedharan

The article sheds light on the importance of context in corporate communications and the impact of leadership rhetoric on employee morale.

item.title: Angel One Q3 Results | Net profit up 8%, revenue rises 19%; interim dividend declared - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Angel One Q3 Results | Net profit up 8%, revenue rises 19%; interim dividend declared

Publication Date: January 13, 2024 | Source: CNBC TV18

Angel One Ltd reported an 8.1% increase in net profit for Q3, along with a 19.2% rise in revenue from operations.

  • Net profit stood at ₹281.4 crore, up from ₹260.4 crore in Q3 of the previous fiscal.
  • Revenue from operations rose to ₹1,262.2 crore compared to ₹1,059 crore in the last year’s quarter.
  • EBITDA increased by 24.7% to ₹496 crore, with an EBITDA margin of 39.3%.
  • A total of 2.1 million new clients were added, despite a decline from the previous quarter.
  • The average daily turnover decreased by 11.8% from ₹45.4 trillion in Q2 FY25.
  • The board declared an interim dividend of ₹11 per equity share, amounting to approximately ₹99.3 crore.
Dinesh Thakkar, Chairman and Managing Director, stated, "India’s capital market remains on a growth trajectory, reflecting increasing trust among retail investors."

In conclusion, Angel One's Q3 results indicate robust financial growth despite some challenges, with a positive outlook for future quarters.

item.title: JSW Group’s JSW Cement gets Sebi nod for ₹4000 crore IPO; details here | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
JSW Cement Secures Approval for ₹4000 Crore IPO from Sebi

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Live Mint

JSW Cement Limited has received final observation from SEBI to raise ₹4000 crore through an initial public offering (IPO), following its application submitted on August 16.

  1. The IPO consists of a fresh issue of up to ₹2000 crore and an offer for sale of the same amount by Investor Selling Shareholders.
  2. Key shareholders involved in the offer for sale include AP Asia Opportunistic Holdings Pte. Ltd. and Synergy Metals Investments Holding Limited.
  3. Funds raised will partially finance a new cement facility in Nagaur, Rajasthan.
  4. JSW Cement is recognized as one of India's fastest-growing cement companies as per CRISIL.
  5. In FY 2023, the company reported a 31.11% increase in sales volume, significantly surpassing the industry average growth of 6.35%.
  6. The IPO is being managed by several book-running lead managers including JM Financial Limited and Goldman Sachs (India) Securities Private Limited.
"JSW Cement is one of the fastest cement manufacturing companies in India in terms of increased installed grinding capacity and sales volume from Fiscal 2014 to Fiscal 2024." - CRISIL Report

The move to raise capital marks a significant step for JSW Cement in expanding its operations and enhancing its market share in the competitive Indian cement industry.

item.title: L&T HR head says SN Subrahmanyan's words were taken out of context: 'His remarks were casual' - Moneycontrol
item.description:
L&T HR Head Addresses Controversy Over SN Subrahmanyan's Comments

Date: January 13, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

Sonica Muraleedharan, L&T's HR head, emphasized that remarks made by SN Subrahmanyan were taken out of context. She defended his casual comments, highlighting the importance of recognizing his positive influence on growth.

  • SN Subrahmanyan's comments interpreted as casual remarks, not meant to offend.
  • Sonica Muraleedharan asserts the importance of understanding leaders' intentions.
  • The discussion has sparked significant attention within the company.
“Leaders like SNS (SN Subrahmanyan) inspire positive change and growth, and it’s vital to recognize their efforts rather than misinterpret them.” - Sonica Muraleedharan

This incident brings attention to the need for clarity and context in communication, especially in leadership roles.

item.title: Satellite War! China “Shoots Downs” Thousands Of Starlink Satellites In Simulation Ops As Musk’s Internet Worries PLA - EurAsian Times
item.description:
China Simulates Hunting Starlink Satellites Amid Space Militarization Concerns

Date: January 3, 2024 | Source: South China Morning Post

Chinese scientists have conducted a simulation operation targeting Elon Musk's Starlink satellite network, demonstrating that the constellation is vulnerable. The peer-reviewed study reveals that 99 Chinese satellites could approach about 1,400 Starlink satellites within 12 hours.

  • Simulation led by Wu Yunhua from Nanjing University of Aeronautics and Astronautics.
  • Findings suggest the Chinese military sees Starlink as a threat due to its utility in conflicts like Russia-Ukraine.
  • China’s Qianfan project aims to establish over 15,000 low-Earth orbit satellites as a competitor to Starlink.
  • The simulation utilized AI technology modeled after whale hunting strategies to succeed.
  • Concerns persist over China’s potential militarization of space as it develops new satellite interception technologies.
“A combination of soft and hard kill methods should be adopted to make some Starlink satellites lose their functions and destroy the constellation’s operating system.”

These developments signify growing tensions surrounding the use of satellite technology in military operations, raising alarms about a potential space arms race.

item.title: Diageo India names Praveen Someshwar to succeed Hina Nagarajan as MD & CEO - Storyboard18
item.description:
Diageo India Names Praveen Someshwar to Succeed Hina Nagarajan as MD & CEO

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Diageo India has announced the appointment of Praveen Someshwar as the new Managing Director and CEO, succeeding Hina Nagarajan, who is taking on a global position. Someshwar will officially assume his role on April 1, 2025.

  • Praveen Someshwar brings 24 years of experience from PepsiCo.
  • He has held various leadership positions including Senior Vice President & GM in Asia.
  • Hina Nagarajan has been MD and CEO since July 2021 and led significant growth in Diageo's operations.
“Under her leadership, AEM transformed to become a significant growth driver for Africa whilst doubling operating margins.”

The transition comes as Diageo seeks to strengthen its leadership ahead of future growth.

item.title: HCL Tech Q3 Results Live Updates: HCL Tech posts 5.5% growth, announces Rs 18 dividend - The Financial Express
item.description:
HCL Tech Quarterly Earnings and Results Live Updates

Date: January 13, 2025 Source: Financial Express

HCL Tech has reported a net profit of Rs 4,591 crore for the fiscal third quarter, representing a year-on-year growth of 5.54%. Revenue from operations was recorded at Rs 29,890 crore, marking a 5.08% increase compared to the previous year. The company has also declared a dividend of Rs 18 per equity share for the financial year 2024-25, which includes a special dividend in celebration of its 25 years of public listing.

  • Net profit for Q3 FY25: Rs 4,591 crore, up 5.54% YoY
  • Revenue from operations: Rs 29,890 crore, up 5.08% YoY
  • Fourth interim dividend announced: Rs 18 per share
  • Attrition rate increased to 13.2%
  • New deal TCV for Q3: $2,095 million
“HCLTech is well positioned as AI-led transformation brings new opportunities for growth.” - Roshni Nadar Malhotra, Chairperson, HCL Tech

The third quarter results indicate a steady growth trajectory for HCL Tech, amidst economic challenges, highlighting its strong position in the IT sector.

item.title: India's passenger car EV market to double in 2 years: Hyundai's Tarun Garg - Business Standard
item.description:
India's Passenger Car EV Market Expected to Double by 2025, Says Hyundai's Tarun Garg

Publication Date: Not specified   Source: Not specified

Hyundai Motor India anticipates significant growth in the passenger electric vehicle market, projecting the volumes to double over the next two years due to new launches by major manufacturers.

  • Launch of the Creta Electric SUV at the Bharat Mobility Global Auto Expo.
  • Passenger EV volume in India expected to reach approximately 212,000 units by 2025 from around 106,000 in 2023.
  • Current EV penetration at 2.4% is forecasted to rise to 17% by 2030.
  • Hyundai plans to launch three additional EV models after the Creta EV.
  • Production capacity aims to increase to 1.1 million units by 2028.
“If you look at the EV wholesale numbers, they will broadly be around 106,000 in 2023… I personally feel that EV volumes can double in the next two years.” - Tarun Garg

The Creta Electric will compete with other models such as the Maruti Suzuki e-Vitara and Tata Curvv, featuring impressive ranges of up to 473 kilometers on a single charge.

Hyundai is actively working on localizing its entire EV supply chain in India, partnering with local firms for battery production and drivetrains.

With rising consumer demand for automatic options and advanced features, Hyundai's focus on electrification positions it strongly in the evolving automotive landscape.

item.title: HCL Tech Q3 Results: Net profit rises 5.5% to ₹4,591 crore, revenue up 5% YoY; dividend declared | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
HCL Tech Q3 Results: Net profit rises 5.5% to ₹4,591 crore, revenue up 5% YoY; dividend declared

Date: January 13, 2025 | Source: Live Mint

HCL Technologies reported a 5.5% increase in net profit and a 5% rise in revenue for the Q3FY25. The company also declared a dividend as it marks 25 years since its public listing.

  • Consolidated net profit reached ₹4,591 crore.
  • Revenue from operations for Q3FY25 rose to ₹29,890 crore.
  • Interim dividend declared: ₹18 per share, including a special dividend of ₹6.
  • New deal wins for the quarter were $2.1 billion.
  • Updated revenue growth forecast for FY25 is now 4.5% to 5% in constant currency.
“HCL Tech is well positioned as AI-led transformation brings new opportunities for growth.” - Roshni Nadar, Chairperson, HCL Tech

The results reflect HCL Tech's strong performance and confidence in future growth driven by AI and digital offerings.

item.title: Stock market crash: 5 reasons why Sensex tanked by over 1,000 points - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Stock market crash: The Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) benchmark index Sensex tanked by 1,048.90 points to close at 76,330

Date: Jan 13, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

On January 13, 2025, the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) saw a significant drop in the Sensex index, falling by over 1,000 points due to various negative market influences.

  • The crash was largely attributed to unfavorable global market cues.
  • Foreign Institutional Investors (FIIs) sold off equities worth ₹2,254.68 crore.
  • The rupee fell to a historic low against the US dollar, exacerbating market conditions.
  • Brent crude oil prices surged above $80 a barrel, raising inflation concerns.
  • Upcoming budget expectations contributed to a restrained market sentiment.
“Rising crude oil prices would raise concerns of a spike in domestic inflation, which could further delay any rate cut hopes from the RBI in the near to medium term.” – Prashanth Tapse, Senior VP (Research), Mehta Equities Ltd

This dramatic drop in the stock market reflects broader economic uncertainties and highlights the interconnectedness of global events affecting domestic markets.

item.title: PSU Bank index is down 26% from its peak — These lenders offer the biggest upside - CNBCTV18
item.description:
PSU Bank index is down 26% from its peak — These lenders offer the biggest upside

Publication Date: January 13, 2024 Source: CNBC TV18

The Nifty PSU Bank index has slipped 26% from its peak on June 3 and is exhibiting potential for recovery among several key state-owned lenders.

  • The PSU Bank index declined an additional 3% on January 13, marking four consecutive days of losses.
  • All 12 constituents of the index have experienced declines of 20% to 40% since June 3.
  • Top-performing stocks such as SBI have a projected upside of 33% after a 20% decline.
  • Union Bank has faced the most significant loss at 41%, offset by the highest projected upside of 43%.
“These state-run lenders have corrected between 20% to 40% but offer the highest upside potential post this fall.”

This situation presents a mixed bag for investors; while stock prices have dipped, analysts foresee potential recoveries for many PSU Bank stocks, making this a critical time for strategic investments.

item.title: Zara Dar says she was blocked on Elon Musk's X for… - The Times of India
item.description:
Zara Dar reports being blocked on Elon Musk's X platform

Publication Date: N/A | Source: Times of India

Zara Dar, a prominent figure, has claimed that she has been blocked on Elon Musk's social media platform, X. This incident raises questions about the dynamics of online censorship and user interactions.

  • Zara Dar's account of being blocked on X.
  • Discussion on online censorship practices.
  • Implications for user freedom of speech on social media platforms.
"This experience has made me reflect on the transparency of user interactions on social media platforms."

This incident highlights ongoing concerns regarding censorship and the control social media platforms wield over user interactions.

item.title: Why rupee breached 86 against US dollar: strengthening dollar, weak FII inflows - The Indian Express
item.description:
Why the Rupee Breached 86 Against US Dollar: Strengthening Dollar, Weak FII Inflows

Publication Date: Not provided Source: Indian Express

The rupee fell past the 86 mark against the US dollar on account of a strengthening dollar and weakening foreign institutional investor inflows, amid rising crude oil prices.

  • The rupee opened at 86.12 and hit a low of 86.31 against the dollar.
  • Factors leading to this depreciation include a strong dollar and high crude oil prices.
  • The US jobs report showed NFP at 256,000, outpacing expectations.
  • Capital outflows from Indian markets have reached approximately $4.2 billion in January 2025.
  • The rupee is expected to trade within the range of 85.80–86.50 in the near term.
“This sustained decline reflects a combination of global and domestic pressures.” - Amit Pabari, Managing Director, CR Forex Advisors

item.title: Nithin Kamath to Shankar Sharma: How stock market mavens reacted to today's Sensex crash | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Reactions from Stock Market Experts on Today's Sensex Crash

Publication Date: January 13, 2025 | Source: Live Mint

The stock market experienced a significant downturn, with analysts and investors expressing their sentiments on the unprecedented sell-off that impacted all indices.

  • The Sensex fell by 1.36%, settling at 76,330.01.
  • The Nifty dropped by 1.47%, ending at 23,085.95.
  • Mid-cap and small-cap stocks plunged by around 4% each.
  • A total of ₹13 lakh crore was wiped off from investor wealth.
  • Nithin Kamath shared a grimacing emoji and a screenshot of the market, reflecting widespread losses.
  • Shankar Sharma humorously tweeted about losing his shirt in the market.
  • Deepak Shenoy suggested that market corrections could provide buying opportunities for long-term investors.
"Lost my shirt in the market today." — Shankar Sharma
"Markets are brutal sometimes, but strong down days are usually a good sign of capitulation." — Deepak Shenoy

This crash has raised concerns among investors but also highlights potential opportunities for those looking to invest long-term.
